page.title: 16Changes in Farming
page.content: Lots of small farms have now been swallowed up by bigger ones.In West Taphouse alone there were three farms: {West Taphouse Farm,Cross Close Farm and{Wayton Farm.}Now there are none. The houses have been sold to private individuals and the land taken over by other tenant farmers. Much machinery has taken over the jobs of people,for example,potato planters, hay balers and milking machines. Milk churns have been replaced by bulk tankers.Tractors have replaced horses. Silage is new and artificial manure is now used. The farming is more intensified now, more going under the plough.Small fields are being enlarged and much of the Downs land has been reclaimed. Some crops are subsidised by the Government. {From an interview with G.Symons(age86)
